data.title: Analog Baran Carther
data.statement:
This is the year 5451!
Now, the world is dominated by robots. And there are now only 3 brands of clocks: {{Analog}}, {{Baran}} and {{Carther}} clocks.

{{Analog}} clocks are now used to celebrate the victory of the robots dominating humanity. The format of an analog clock output is what you would get on a regular analog clock: hh:mm:ss. For example 13 hours 4 minutes and 55 seconds in an Analog clock will be 13:04:55

{{Baran}} clocks is named after the famous dude who invented robots. The format of a baran clock is (bin)hhhhh:(bin)mmmmmm:(bin)ssssss (bin means binary format). For example 13 hours 4 minutes and 55 seconds in a baran clock will be 01101:000100:110111

{{Carther}} clocks is named after the famouse robot who killed Carther (The last remaning programmer (All of humanity in the year 5451 are programmers)). The format of a carther clock output is (hex)hh:(hex)mm:(hex)ss (hex means hexadecimal format). For example 13 hours 4 minutes and 55 seconds in a carther clock will be 0D:04:37

Your job, given the input of an {{Analog}} or {{Baran}} or {{Carther}} clock is to convert it into another clock format.
data.constraints: Conversion clocks will never be the same, i.e. [[c]] â‰  [[d]]

data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: The output of the clock.
<<Line 2>>: The clock name ({{Analog}} or {{Baran}} or {{Carther}}) [[c]], an arrow [[a]] ({{->}} or {{<-}}), and another clock name ({{Analog}} or {{Baran}} or {{Carther}}) [[d]], separated by spaces.
data.outputDescription: If the arrow [[a]] is {{->}}, then you need to convert the clock from clock [[c]] to the format of clock [[d]] and output it. If the arrow [[a]] is {{<-}} convert the clock from the format of clock [[d]] to the format of clock [[c]] and output it.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

This is the year 5451!
Now, the world is dominated by robots. And there are now only 3 brands of clocks: Analog, Baran and Carther clocks.

Analog clocks are now used to celebrate the victory of the robots dominating humanity. The format of an analog clock output is what you would get on a regular analog clock: hh:mm:ss. For example 13 hours 4 minutes and 55 seconds in an Analog clock will be 13:04:55

Baran clocks is named after the famous dude who invented robots. The format of a baran clock is (bin)hhhhh:(bin)mmmmmm:(bin)ssssss (bin means binary format). For example 13 hours 4 minutes and 55 seconds in a baran clock will be 01101:000100:110111

Carther clocks is named after the famouse robot who killed Carther (The last remaning programmer (All of humanity in the year 5451 are programmers)). The format of a carther clock output is (hex)hh:(hex)mm:(hex)ss (hex means hexadecimal format). For example 13 hours 4 minutes and 55 seconds in a carther clock will be 0D:04:37

Your job, given the input of an Analog or Baran or Carther clock is to convert it into another clock format.
Input
Line 1: The output of the clock.
Line 2: The clock name (Analog or Baran or Carther) c, an arrow a (-> or <-), and another clock name (Analog or Baran or Carther) d, separated by spaces.
Output
If the arrow a is ->, then you need to convert the clock from clock c to the format of clock d and output it. If the arrow a is <- convert the clock from the format of clock d to the format of clock c and output it.
Constraints
Conversion clocks will never be the same, i.e. c ≠ d
Example
Input
13:04:55
Analog -> Baran
Output
01101:000100:110111
